alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier; Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:49PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Glacier County through 745 PM MDT... At 647 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking numerous thunderstorms across northwestern Glacier County. The strongest thunderstorm was located 22 miles north of Kiowa, or 50 miles west of Cut Bank, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Babb and Saint Mary. This includes Highway 89 between mile markers 20 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
